page.title: 11THE MILL AT MICHAELCHURCH.
page.content: The Mill was built about 250 years ago to serve the village.{It was water {driven}using a mill race from the {Escley Brook.}The present owner is rebuilding it.Ever since he has been born the mill has not worked.So far it has taken him 15 months and he hopes to have it finished by{June 1986.} There are three floors in the original building.The bottom floor will be a store room.The second floor had been cemented over by the previous owner.Whilst removing this old cement they found some of the original {grinding wheels.}It is hoped to get the water wheel turning again.The old shed at the side is being converted into a granny flat. In the past when the mill was working the flour was taken across to Mill House where the bread was baked.
